Macron appoints Sébastien Lecornu as France's prime minister
subhead: One day after François Bayrou lost a vote of confidence, Emmanuel Macron asked Sébastien Lecornu, a longtime loyalist who had served as defense minister since 2022, to form a government.

US judge blocks Trump from firing Fed governor, for now
subhead: Donald Trump's move to fire Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook was temporarily blocked by a federal judge on Tuesday as Cook challenges her ouster from the central bank.

headline: Hamas says six dead after Israeli army strikes militant group's buildings in Qatar
subhead: Qatar said Israeli strikes targeted Hamas leaders' homes in a 'cowardly' attack. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he ordered the strikes in response to a shooting in Jerusalem on Monday.

headline: Blessed with fortune: India's Hare Krishna mega-temple backed by a Ford heir
subhead: In Mayapur, the monument built in honor of Krishna by his followers could, by 2027, become the largest religious building in the world. This colossal project, begun in 2010, has been largely funded by Alfred Ford, the great-grandson of the car manufacturer.

headline: 'Block Everything' movement: 'The goal is no longer to overthrow capitalism but simply to make it less cruel for the most disadvantaged'
subhead: Thanks to social media, the September 10 movement 'Block Everything' expresses the direct will of citizens. But this mode of protest also risks prioritizing rhetoric over action, far from the general strikes of the 20th century, writes historian Gérard Noiriel.

Global debt, deficits and inflation put mounting pressure on interest rates
subhead: Accelerated in France by the fall of Prime Minister François Bayrou and his government, the rise in long-term interest rates is affecting most major developed countries.

headline: Macron, a vulnerable president after one dissolution and two failed governments
subhead: The fall of Prime Minister François Bayrou ushers in a new period of political instability. The French president, widely seen as responsible for the crisis within his own ranks, now faces pressure from the opposition to propose a new candidate for the post of prime minister.

headline: François Bayrou's nine months of crises as French PM
subhead: The outgoing prime minister failed to push through any major reform and became known for his muddled leadership style.
